title: How to Make Omija Concentrate

text: Steps Get rid of the unnecessary dirty parts of the Omija.  Be careful not to get rid of the stem part (it has great remedial effect).  Wash the fruits, but be sure that there is no water. Use a sifter. If not, the water will create gas in the bottle. Use a glass or plastic bottle. (Pottery is not recommended because it facilitates fermentation of Omija. Too much will create alcohol.) Put sugar first at the bottom of the bottle and then put Omija on it, and repeat the process, layering one on top of the other. If you put them all in the bottle, put the leftover sugar on top. You should fill only 80% of the bottle, because otherwise, gas can be created during the process and close the cover loosely. Keep the bottle in cool area and stir it once in 10 days, so the sunk sugar can be dissolved perfectly.  After 60 days, it will start to liquify. (The time depends on the condition of the fruits and the temperature.) Use sifter to get rid of solid ingredients and after that, use thin clothes to get rid of the left solid ingredients once or twice when Omija becomes little bit gray and the shape changes a lot).  Keep it in the refrigerator, because otherwise it will ferment more.  Make Omija Salad Mix 1/2 cup of Omija concentrate and 6 cups of water together in a bowl.  Add the fruit.  Omija Drink Mix cider and Omija concentrate together.  Add ice before drinking.
